H0.text: In medicine an emetic is administered to induce what. Vomit

H1.text: In medicine an emetic is administered to induce what. Nausea

H2.text: In medicine an emetic is administered to induce what. Diarrhea

H3.text: In medicine an emetic is administered to induce what. Puke

A4.text: Inducing vomiting can remove the substance before it is absorbed into the body.

A5.text: Emetics can be divided into two categories: those which produce their effect by acting on the vomiting center in the medulla, and those which act directly on the stomach itself.
